He who makes it, knows it. He who takes it, knows it not. An honest man who knows it, gives it not.

What is it?

I'm going to give the obviously-wrong-but-very-smart-alecky answer of: A pop quiz

Where on earth does honesty arise in a pop quiz? xD

NOPE.

Vexx, you are a sly one

Bad advice?

Ehehe.

Not quite. An honest man may quite easily give bad advice without actually being dishonest. Merely because the advice is bad does not imply sinister or dishonest intent; it could merely be a complete lack of better advice to give.
Is it "Poison"?
is it lies

Is it "Poison"?

Nope. Honest men give poison to people all the time. In practically non-existent doses.

is it lies

Of a sense, I suppose. But the wording implies a concrete object. You might tell lies to someone, but giving a lie to someone... just isn't quite the same, y'know? On the right track, though!
Counterfeit money?
is it fool's gold or a exaggerated story

is it fool's gold or a exaggerated story

Properly put, it's any form of counterfeit goods, but that's pretty dang close enough. Your turn!
